files.README.md:
üêß Welcome to Ubuntu on WebTerm!

‚ú® Features:
- APT package management simulation
- Unity desktop environment references
- Ubuntu-specific commands and tools
- Snap package support simulation

üìö Getting Started:
- Type 'help' to see all available commands
- Type 'apt list' to see available packages
- Type 'snap list' to see installed snaps
- Type 'ubuntu-bug' for bug reporting info

üé® This is a simulation of Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.
Explore the filesystem and try Ubuntu-specific commands!

üí° Pro tip: Try 'neofetch' to see your Ubuntu system info!
files.notes.txt:
üìù Ubuntu User Notes:

üéØ Todo:
- Update system with 'sudo apt update'
- Install development tools
- Configure desktop environment
- Set up workspace preferences

üí≠ Ubuntu Features:
- LTS (Long Term Support) releases
- Unity/GNOME desktop environment
- APT package manager
- Snap universal packages
- Strong community support

üöÄ Completed:
‚úÖ Initial Ubuntu setup
‚úÖ WebTerm configuration
‚úÖ Basic command familiarity
files..bashrc:
# ~/.bashrc: executed by bash(1) for non-login shells.

# If not running interactively, don't do anything
case $- in
    *i*) ;;
      *) return;;
esac

# History settings
HISTCONTROL=ignoreboth
HISTSIZE=1000
HISTFILESIZE=2000

# Ubuntu aliases
alias ll='ls -alF'
alias la='ls -A'
alias l='ls -CF'
alias grep='grep --color=auto'
alias fgrep='fgrep --color=auto'
alias egrep='egrep --color=auto'

# Ubuntu-specific aliases
alias apt-search='apt search'
alias apt-show='apt show'

# Enable programmable completion features
if ! shopt -oq posix; then
  if [ -f /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion ]; then
    . /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion
  elif [ -f /etc/bash_completion ]; then
    . /etc/bash_completion
  fi
fi
files.important.txt:
üîí Important Ubuntu Information:

üìã System Details:
- Distribution: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)
- Kernel: Linux 5.15.0-generic
- Desktop: GNOME 42
- Package Manager: APT + Snap

üõ†Ô∏è Key Commands:
- sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
- sudo apt install package-name
- snap install package-name
- systemctl status service-name

üåê Resources:
- Ubuntu Official: https://ubuntu.com
- Community Help: https://askubuntu.com
- Documentation: https://help.ubuntu.com

motd: ‚ú® Features: APT | Snap | GNOME | Community Support
üí° Type 'help' for available commands | 'theme' to toggle themes
üéØ Try: apt list, snap list, ubuntu-version, neofetch

help.description: Shows a list of available commands with descriptions

ls.description: Lists files and directories in the current location

pwd.description: Prints the current working directory path
